title: the Courts (Supplemental Provisions) Act 1961 (No. 39 of 1961), section 16 of
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the District Court Districts and Areas
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the District Court Districts and Areas 
(Amendment) and Variation of Days (Meath sitting in Navan and Trim) Order, 
2024 
This Order shall come into operation on 12th February 2024
text_norm: 1 order may cited district court district area (amendment) variation day (meath sitting navan trim) order 2024 order shall come operation 12th february 2024

title: the Courts (Supplemental Provisions) Act 1961 (No. 39 of 1961), section 16 of
heading: 2. The First Schedule to the District Court (Areas) Order, 1961 ( S.I. No. 5
text_raw:
2. The First Schedule to the District Court (Areas) Order, 1961 ( S.I. No. 5 

of 1961 ), is hereby amended by— 

the substitution at reference number 188 for the matter in column (4) of the 
following: 

“Navan — Second and Third Monday in each month. Second and Third 
Tuesday in each month. Second and Third Wednesday in each month. Third 
and Fourth Thursday in each month. Second, Third and Fourth Friday in each 
month. All sittings at 10.30 a.m.”, and 

the substitution at reference number 195 for the matter in column (4) of the 
following: 

“Trim — First, Second, Third and Fourth Tuesday in each month. First, 
Second, Third and Fourth Wednesday in each month. First, Second, Third and 
Fourth Thursday in each month. All sittings at 10.30 a.m.”.
text_norm: 2 first schedule district court (areas) order 1961 ( s.i no 5 1961 ) hereby amended by-- substitution reference number 188 matter column (4) following navan -- second third monday month second third tuesday month second third wednesday month third fourth thursday month second third fourth friday month sitting 10.30 a.m substitution reference number 195 matter column (4) following trim -- first second third fourth tuesday month first second third fourth wednesday month first second third fourth thursday month sitting 10.30 a.m

title: the Courts (Supplemental Provisions) Act 1961 (No. 39 of 1961), section 16 of
heading: 3. The Second Schedule to the District Court (Areas) Order, 1961 (S.I.
text_raw:
3. The Second Schedule to the District Court (Areas) Order, 1961 (S.I. 

No. 5 of 1961), is hereby amended by— 

the substitution at reference number 161 for the matter in column (4) of the 
following: 

“Navan — Second and Third Monday in each month. Second and Third 
Tuesday in each month. Second and Third Wednesday in each month. Third 
and Fourth Thursday in each month. Second, Third and Fourth Friday in each 
month. All sittings at 10.30 a.m.”, and 

the substitution at reference number 165 for the matter in column (4) of the 
following: 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 12th January, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [4] 3 

“Trim — First, Second, Third and Fourth Tuesday in each month. First, 
Second, Third and Fourth Wednesday in each month. First, Second, Third and 
Fourth Thursday in each month. All sittings at 10.30 a.m.”.

title: the Courts (Supplemental Provisions) Act 1961 (No. 39 of 1961), section 16 of
heading: 4. Business transacted in the District Court that is initiated and not
text_raw:
4. Business transacted in the District Court that is initiated and not 
completed before commencement of this Order shall be continued and 
completed as if this Order had been in force at the time at which such business 
had been initiated. 

GIVEN under the Seal of the Courts Service 

8 January 2024. 

PAUL KELLY, 

Member of the Board of the Courts Service authorised to 
sign documents under the Seal of the Courts Service. 

DEIRDRE DOYLE, 

Officer of the Courts Service designated for the purpose 
of authenticating the Seal of the Courts Service, pursuant 
to section 10 of the Courts Service Act 1998. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [4]

title: the Courts (Supplemental Provisions) Act 1961 (No. 39 of 1961), section 16 of

text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This order provides for the variation of Days at Navan and Trim. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [4] 5
